summary: This document appears to be an email exchange between Assistant United States Attorneys in the Southern District of New York regarding a draft legal document related to Federal Rule of Evidence 412 and referencing a 'Smith case'. It shows ongoing legal work on the Epstein case in October 2021.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of email correspondence discussing draft legal work related to Federal Rule of Evidence 412 and referencing the 'Smith case'.

events.title: Legal Drafting on FRE 412
events.description: Assistant United States Attorneys exchange draft legal document regarding Federal Rule of Evidence 412 and discuss the 'Smith case'.

locations.name: New York, New York
locations.context: Location of the United States Attorney's Office handling the case

keyFacts: Legal work on the Epstein case was ongoing as of October 2021, more than two years after Epstein's death.
Prosecutors were working on issues related to Federal Rule of Evidence 412, which governs the admissibility of evidence regarding a victim's sexual behavior or predisposition.
The correspondence references a 'Smith case' that may be relevant precedent for the legal arguments being developed.
The document shows collaboration between Assistant United States Attorneys in the Southern District of New York on the case.
